@ConstitutionParty @ConstitutionPartyServices @ConstitutionPartyLA @ConstitutionPartyofLouisiana @CPofLouisiana @CPofCC1776 @VoterGA History1992: A coalition of independent state parties united to form the U.S. Taxpayers Party. The party‚Äôs founder, Howard Phillips, was on the ballot in 21 states as its first presidential candidate.1995: Party recognized by Federal Election Commission as a national party bringing the number of nationally recognized parties to 5.1999: Name changed to ‚ÄúConstitution Party‚Äù by delegates at the National Convention to better reflect the party‚Äôs primary focus of returning government to the U.S. Constitution‚Äôs provisions and limitations. A BRIEF ELECTION HISTORY1992: A coalition of independent state parties united to form the U.S. Taxpayers Party at its first national convention in New Orleans, Louisiana.  Among the notable convention speakers was former Congressman Ron Paul. The party‚Äôs founder, Howard Phillips of Virginia, Chairman of the grass-roots lobby, the Conservative Caucus, was nominated to be the party‚Äôs first candidate for President with retired Army Brigadier General Albion Knight of Maryland nominated as the party‚Äôs first vice-presidential running mate. The US Taxpayer‚Äôs Party secured ballot position in 21 states.1996: Howard Phillips was again nominated to be the party‚Äôs presidential candidate for the 1996 campaign at the party‚Äôs national convention held in San Diego, California.  Attorney and writer Herb Titus of Oregon was the Constitution Party‚Äôs Vice President nominee. Ballot access was achieved in 39 states for the 1996 elections, representing over 80% of the Electoral College votes available.2000: Delegates attending the National Convention in September 1999 voted to change the name of the US Taxpayer‚Äôs Party to ‚ÄúConstitution Party‚Äù to better reflect the party‚Äôs primary focus of returning government to the U.S. Constitution‚Äôs provisions and limitations.  For a third and last time, Howard Phillips was nominated to serve as the standard bearer for the newly named Constitution Party for the 2000 election. Missouri surgeon Dr. J. Curtis Frazier was the nominee for Vice President. The convention was held in St. Louis, Missouri.2004: The Constitution Party achieved ballot access in 41 states and, at its convention in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania, it nominated Maryland lawyer Michael Peroutka, founder of the Institute on the Constitution, as its presidential nominee with Florida minister and commentator Chuck Baldwin as its nominee for Vice-President. Although the Constitution Party was on fewer state ballots in 2004, the vote tally increased by 40 percent compared to the 2000 elections while other ‚Äòalternative‚Äô parties lost ground or barely matched their 2000 vote totals.2008: At its Kansas City, Missouri national convention, the Constitution Party nominated its 2004 nominee for Vice President, Chuck Baldwin of Florida, to be its 2008 nominee for President, selecting attorney and Constitution Party activist Darrell Castle of Tennessee, to serve as the Vice-presidential nominee.2012: Former six-term Virginia Congressman, Virgil Goode, was nominated for President at the Constitution Party National Convention held in Nashville, Tennessee. Three-term Constitution Party National Chairman, attorney Jim Clymer of Pennsylvania, was nominated to serve as Goode‚Äôs running mate.2016: Founding Constitution Party member, three term Vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Constitution Party, and 2008 Constitution Party Vice-presidential Candidate Darrell Castle was nominated for President. Mr. Castle‚Äôs running mate was Dr. Scott Bradley of Utah who holds a PhD in Constitutional Law. The campaign garnered over 200,000 votes setting a Constitution Party record.
group.title: THE CONSTITUTION PARTY     The true Patriot Party of America

_source.content: @ericdondero @Zero60 @Cmac63 @OikophobiaI tried posting this on your website eric, but don't know if it posted?I just noticed this  comment:‚ÄúHow could homo naledi deal in the dark‚Äù asks Lee Berger. Inside the chamber he realized the ‚Äúroof‚Äù had blackened areas with soot particles indicating an astounding use of fire. Later his team found burnt animal bones in another chamber."So there was no cooking in the hard to get to chamber, it was in ANOTHER CHAMBER, where a large primate, with a larger brain capable of using fire, was hunting, caught Homo Naledi, dropped him on the cave floor, thinking it was dead, and it tended the fire getting it ready for cooking, but H.N. woke up and scampered into the narrow entrance where it would be momentarily safe, but died eventually from it's "hunting" injuries, or starved to death.I never "liked" the idea that something with a brain the size of an orange could use fire, and I "smelled a rat" right away, and now I think that "rat died," and it stinks more than before.
_source.contentraw:
@ericdondero @Zero60 @Cmac63 @Oikophobia

I tried posting this on your website eric, but don't know if it posted?

I just noticed this comment:

‚ÄúHow could homo naledi deal in the dark‚Äù asks Lee Berger. Inside the chamber he realized the ‚Äúroof‚Äù had blackened areas with soot particles indicating an astounding use of fire. Later his team found burnt animal bones in another chamber."

So there was no cooking in the hard to get to chamber, it was in ANOTHER CHAMBER, where a large primate, with a larger brain capable of using fire, was hunting, caught Homo Naledi, dropped him on the cave floor, thinking it was dead, and it tended the fire getting it ready for cooking, but H.N. woke up and scampered into the narrow entrance where it would be momentarily safe, but died eventually from it's "hunting" injuries, or starved to death.

I never "liked" the idea that something with a brain the size of an orange could use fire, and I "smelled a rat" right away, and now I think that "rat died," and it stinks more than before.

http://www.humansubspecies.com Human Origins, Paleontology, Anthropology from a right-wing perspective.  Conservatives and libertarians are welcomed here. Race Realism without the hate.  Please no NeoNazi crap, White Supremacists, Jew haters.  You will be moderated.  

GLOSSARY OF TERMS USED HERE:

Australopithecines - Lucy - Afarensis, Anamensis, Africanus 3.9 million to 2.4 million years ago
Denisovans - Altai, Southern, 600k to 10kya, mainly in Asia, Melanesia
Ardipithecus (Ardi - Ethiopia), Sahelanthropus tchadensis (Chad), Hobbits/Homo floresiensis.  Popular Paleo-anthropologists: John "Johnny Boy" Hawkes - Univ. of Wisconsin, Lee Berger - South Africa, discover of both Aust. Sediba and Homo naled, Chris Stringer of the London Museum of Natural History, (Fatty) Sarah Tishkoff of the Univ. of Pennsylvania, Joshua Akey - geneticist, Svante Paabo, Johannes Krause of the Max Plank Inst. Leipzig, Germany, David Reich.

card.description: Restores the real definition of a republic from Aristotle that points to Doric Crete and Sparta as true republics and it traces its appearance throughout history. This article lays out that the republican form of government was bastardized by the
card.title: The Classical definition of a republic 5th Rev.

_source.content: @turbobisley In all actuality, America is NOT a republic, not a true republic. In the Laws, Plato says to the Spartan, that he had a "True Politiea"; now that word was translated as 'republic'. There is not a single American today that will say Sparta is a Republic. But it is a true republic yet Sparta and America look totally different. Something is terribly wrong there, don't you see? Plato is not wrong but the future, past the Renaissance are wrong. I direct you to Eric Nelson's book "The Hebrew Republic"---America is this "Hebrew Republic" which is NOT a republic whatsoever. First to use the term "constitutional republic" is a pleonasm---Republic for its definition has naturally a constitution. No need to say "constitutional". Second, a True Republic is Mixed government that requires a caste society. The Greeks defined the forms of government by which class controlled the government. America doesn't have any castes, so it is naturally a democracy--with roadblocks in it. America is a constitutional democracy, not a true republic. I wrote a sixty page dissertation on that https://www.academia.edu/5280564/

_source.content: I have one for you @Eric-Dubay . . just a simple expeditionRather than complain about what we can't do in AntarcticaLet's focus on what we CAN do, Antarctica surrounds EarthExpedition to survey and measure around the 60th ParallelAfter LEGALLY circumnavigating the 60th, WE HAVE PROOF !That's our next step, we MUST measure around 60th Parallel. . very similar to that big yacht race they have every yearWe don't need to violate any laws to measure 60th ParallelWe invite all private vessels to join our journey around 60th. . we could have an entire CONVOY of private vesselsA simple (and legal) mission to circle and measure the 60thAs illustrated by Capt. Cook . . we will log far to many milesSo what would we find from that journey if the Earth is Flat ?If Earth were actually Flat . . with the North pole at center60th Parallel South, Circumference = 65,293.4 milesIf Earth were some Ba'al . . with a Radius of 3,958.8 miles60th Parallel South, Circumference = 12,936.86 milesOver 50,000 miles FURTHER than should be . . that is Proof !After logging 65,000 miles circumnavigating at 60th ParallelThat would be the profound evidence, nobody could disputeWe would want at least 2 vessels tracking distance separately. . that way there are at least TWO surveys happeningScientific method . . measure and log, confirmed by 2nd vessel. . GPS (if available) would help to stay the course
_source.contentraw:
I have one for you @Eric-Dubay . . just a simple expedition

Rather than complain about what we can't do in Antarctica
Let's focus on what we CAN do, Antarctica surrounds Earth

Expedition to survey and measure around the 60th Parallel
After LEGALLY circumnavigating the 60th, WE HAVE PROOF !

That's our next step, we MUST measure around 60th Parallel
. . very similar to that big yacht race they have every year

We don't need to violate any laws to measure 60th Parallel

We invite all private vessels to join our journey around 60th
. . we could have an entire CONVOY of private vessels

A simple (and legal) mission to circle and measure the 60th
As illustrated by Capt. Cook . . we will log far to many miles

So what would we find from that journey if the Earth is Flat ?

If Earth were actually Flat . . with the North pole at center
60th Parallel South, Circumference = 65,293.4 miles

If Earth were some Ba'al . . with a Radius of 3,958.8 miles
60th Parallel South, Circumference = 12,936.86 miles

Over 50,000 miles FURTHER than should be . . that is Proof !

After logging 65,000 miles circumnavigating at 60th Parallel
That would be the profound evidence, nobody could dispute

We would want at least 2 vessels tracking distance separately
. . that way there are at least TWO surveys happening

Scientific method . . measure and log, confirmed by 2nd vessel
. . GPS (if available) would help to stay the course

Among the international regulatory agencies issuing warnings on these antidepressants, the FDA issued a Public Health Advisory in 2004 warning that ‚Äúanxiety, agitation, panic attacks, insomnia, irritability, hostility, impulsivity, akathisia [severe restlessness], hypomania [abnormal excitement] and mania [psychosis characterized by exalted feelings, delusions of grandeur and overproduction of ideas] have been reported in adult and pediatric patients being treated with antidepressants.‚Äù  (For further information on international studies and warnings about antidepressants, go to CCHR International‚Äôs

card.description: Back in October, New York City Mayor Eric Adams made a joint announcement with Governor Kathy Hochul regarding a new public safety plan for the Big Apple. Dubbed the ‚ÄúCops, Cameras and Care‚Äù program,...
card.title: Could it be true? Crime down on NYC subways?

_source.content: #SustainableLiving #PublicTransportationCould it be true? Crime down on New York City subways?Hotair ^ | 01/28/2023 | Jazz Shawhttps://hotair.com/jazz-shaw/2023/01/28/could-it-be-true-crime-down-on-nyc-subways-n526983Back in October, New York City Mayor Eric Adams made a joint announcement with Governor Kathy Hochul regarding a new public safety plan for the Big Apple. Dubbed the ‚ÄúCops, Cameras and Care‚Äù program, they claimed that they would be adding more than one thousand additional police officers to the MTA force patrolling the subways. More surveillance cameras would be installed and they would begin moving most of the homeless out of the tunnels and into shelters. The state would provide a significant chunk of the money needed to make that happen. I‚Äôll confess to having been a bit dubious when they made that announcement. We hear plenty of big talk from New York politicians, but it rarely translates into productive action. But perhaps they actually did something right this time. It was announced yesterday that a significant drop in subway crime rates has been observed over the past few months.The rate of subway crime in the Big Apple has declined since the launch of a new safety plan in October, Mayor Eric Adams and Gov. Kathy Hochul announced Friday.During a joint appearance at the Fulton Transit Center in Lower Manhattan, officials unveiled NYPD figures that showed subway crimes were now occurring at a rate of 1.7 incidents per 1 million riders, down from 2.3 incidents in 2021 and 2022.The rate is now nearly at the same level of 1.5 incidents per 1 million riders before the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, during which ridership plunged and crime spiked to 2.8 per 1 million.It‚Äôs not that often that we have the opportunity to celebrate any good news coming out of our larger cities, so I try to take that chance when the occasion arises. And if these numbers continue to remain down through the rest of the winter and the spring, we may be seeing a trend toward improvement. Crime rates in the subway system almost doubled over the course of the pandemic and through most of last year.Another major improvement has been the significantly reduced number of homeless people in the tunnels, though that took many months to accomplish. The city has reportedly moved more than 3,000 homeless people into various shelters that have been established or expanded. Wherever you find large congregations of the homeless, you see increases in nearly all forms of crime. It‚Äôs just a fact of life.The question now is whether or not these new policies can be sustained. The city has already burned through 62 million dollars in state funding to cover all of the costs associated with this expanded police presence. That money is going to be running out in the near future and New York‚Äôs City Council hasn‚Äôt even suggested they will be able to replace it with existing municipal funds without making major cuts elsewhere in the budget.That fact should remind us of the underlying reality. Having the funding put in place for these programs was critical, but cash doesn‚Äôt make crime rates drop. These gains were achieved by the men and women of the NYPD who are out there every night putting their lives on the line. This should also be the final nail in the coffin of the entire ‚Äúdefund the police‚Äù movement. When New York‚Äôs police had their budget cut and their numbers dwindled, crime rates rose dramatically. When the funding was expanded and the force numbers increased, crime dropped in response. Is this really still a mystery to anyone? It shouldn‚Äôt be. It‚Äôs just a shame that we had to produce so many more victims of crime in New York City for more than two years to drive that lesson home. So let‚Äôs do away entirely with all of this ‚Äúdefund the police‚Äù nonsense once and for all, shall we?
_source.contentraw:
#SustainableLiving #PublicTransportation
Could it be true? Crime down on New York City subways?
Hotair ^ | 01/28/2023 | Jazz Shaw
https://hotair.com/jazz-shaw/2023/01/28/could-it-be-true-crime-down-on-nyc-subways-n526983

Back in October, New York City Mayor Eric Adams made a joint announcement with Governor Kathy Hochul regarding a new public safety plan for the Big Apple. Dubbed the ‚ÄúCops, Cameras and Care‚Äù program, they claimed that they would be adding more than one thousand additional police officers to the MTA force patrolling the subways. More surveillance cameras would be installed and they would begin moving most of the homeless out of the tunnels and into shelters. The state would provide a significant chunk of the money needed to make that happen. I‚Äôll confess to having been a bit dubious when they made that announcement. We hear plenty of big talk from New York politicians, but it rarely translates into productive action. But perhaps they actually did something right this time. It was announced yesterday that a significant drop in subway crime rates has been observed over the past few months.

The rate of subway crime in the Big Apple has declined since the launch of a new safety plan in October, Mayor Eric Adams and Gov. Kathy Hochul announced Friday.

During a joint appearance at the Fulton Transit Center in Lower Manhattan, officials unveiled NYPD figures that showed subway crimes were now occurring at a rate of 1.7 incidents per 1 million riders, down from 2.3 incidents in 2021 and 2022.

The rate is now nearly at the same level of 1.5 incidents per 1 million riders before the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, during which ridership plunged and crime spiked to 2.8 per 1 million.

It‚Äôs not that often that we have the opportunity to celebrate any good news coming out of our larger cities, so I try to take that chance when the occasion arises. And if these numbers continue to remain down through the rest of the winter and the spring, we may be seeing a trend toward improvement. Crime rates in the subway system almost doubled over the course of the pandemic and through most of last year.

Another major improvement has been the significantly reduced number of homeless people in the tunnels, though that took many months to accomplish. The city has reportedly moved more than 3,000 homeless people into various shelters that have been established or expanded. Wherever you find large congregations of the homeless, you see increases in nearly all forms of crime. It‚Äôs just a fact of life.

The question now is whether or not these new policies can be sustained. The city has already burned through 62 million dollars in state funding to cover all of the costs associated with this expanded police presence. That money is going to be running out in the near future and New York‚Äôs City Council hasn‚Äôt even suggested they will be able to replace it with existing municipal funds without making major cuts elsewhere in the budget.

That fact should remind us of the underlying reality. Having the funding put in place for these programs was critical, but cash doesn‚Äôt make crime rates drop. These gains were achieved by the men and women of the NYPD who are out there every night putting their lives on the line. This should also be the final nail in the coffin of the entire ‚Äúdefund the police‚Äù movement. When New York‚Äôs police had their budget cut and their numbers dwindled, crime rates rose dramatically. When the funding was expanded and the force numbers increased, crime dropped in response. Is this really still a mystery to anyone? It shouldn‚Äôt be. It‚Äôs just a shame that we had to produce so many more victims of crime in New York City for more than two years to drive that lesson home. So let‚Äôs do away entirely with all of this ‚Äúdefund the police‚Äù nonsense once and for all, shall we?

group.description:
Sustainable Living
Federalized housing and zoning codes. 
This is tied in with immigration and global warming.
As the Democrats import more and more illiterate immigrants, they need housing.
Historically, immigrants tend to live in neighborhoods of people with similar cultures.
America's melting pot becomes a salad bowl.
In the 90s the liberals bussed our children to violent neighborhoods and violent kids to nice neighborhoods. These were mostly Black and White.
When the families moved to better school districts it left the liberal cities a void.
That void was filled with illegal aliens.
This created inequalities and segregation. 
It also led to drive-by-shootings and violence in the schools. 
Gang wars pitted the immigrants against one another and blacks.
Teachers wouldn't teach in violent cities and left those kids to be educated by subpar teachers.

Climate alarmism was created by the United Nations and introduced to congress by Nancy Pelosi in 1992 as Agenda 21.
https://www.congress.gov/bill/102nd-congress/house-concurrent-resolution/353
The United Nations wants to be unelected global leaders with open borders.
Pelosi made her open borders stance clear when in 2016 she flew to Mexico City and got former
Mexico President Vicente Fox to declare Trump voters as "lazy drunks".
https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/pelosi-vicente-fox-plot-to-defeat-trump-mexican-calls-trump-voters-lazy-drunks

California's Governor Newsom within a week after defending his recall, made a law by decree that every neighborhood would have to provide affordable housing. With low income high density housing comes public transportation, light rail, dedicated bus lanes, bicycle trails, removing lanes from streets.

Agenda 21 envisioned returning land back to nature, which explains Obama's and Biden's land grab. 

Obama:
Since taking office, I‚Äôve set aside more than 260 million acres of public lands and waters ‚Äî more than any President in history.
http://news.investors.com/politics-andrew-malcolm/102415-777311-obama-protecting-the-land-is-important.htm

Under guise of climate change, Biden wants to make 30% of U.S. land off limits Expanded government plan means he's coming for private property

card.title: Secret founding of America: Freemasons, Illuminati, & the Church of Rome

_source.content: America is NOT a Christian nation--was never conceived as such.Are there any Christian symbols on the US Flag?  Let's compare and contrast that with the British Flag. The British Flag has TWO Christian symbols on it, the St George and St Andrew crosses. If you look at all the Old flags of Europe--they all had Christian symbology. NOT with the American flag. The symbol on the American flag is a star--that is the symbol of Judeo-Masonic-Bolshevism. The star reappears as a symbol of the USSR, another Judeo-Masonic-Bolshevist creation. The Star appears as a symbol for the Chinese, North Korean and North Vietnamese military insignia and flags! The Star also appears on the flag of the European Union! The Star is the symbol of Judeo-Masonic Bolshevism, of the Hermetic/Kabbalist system. George Washington was a full blown Mason; he was in Masonic regalia when he set the cornerstone for the capitol. Freemasonry is Noahidism. Deism. Thomas Jefferson was a Socianist---meaning, he did not accept the orthodox Catholic teaching that God is a Trinity!  He was not a member of Masonry but went to Masonic meetings and had both Masonic and Rosicrucian literature in his library. He was NOT a Christian but a Deist, which is NOT Christianity. The first commandant of West Point was a Rosicrucian. Now, we come to the symbology of the US Seal. Any Christian symbology on the US Seal?   NO.
